filePackage.FileSystemTree.FileNode

      children is sub directories of files of this node
      Methods in filePackage with parameters of type FileSystemTree.FileNode 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      private void FileSystemTree.addDir​(FileSystemTree.FileNode head, java.lang.String[] path)
      this function adds a directory to it's desired location I have used a recursion to trace the general tree and find the desired location to add a directory if exist function takes a path as a String arrays which's last element is the name of the directory to be added to the general tree also head or root of the tree to start tracing from.
      private void FileSystemTree.addFile​(FileSystemTree.FileNode head, java.lang.String[] path)
      this function adds a file to it's desired location I have used the recursion to trace the general tree and find the desired location to add a file if exist function takes a path as a String arrays which's last element is the name of the file to be added to the general tree also head or root of the tree to start tracing from.
      private boolean FileSystemTree.isExist​(java.lang.String nodeName, FileSystemTree.FileNode head)
      this function takes a string and a node reference and checks whether node's children contains the given nodeName string or not
      private void FileSystemTree.print​(FileSystemTree.FileNode node)
      this function prints the whole general tree using recursion.
      private void FileSystemTree.remove​(FileSystemTree.FileNode head, java.lang.String[] path)
      this function takes path and head and removes a file or directory if exist or if possible by using recursion.
      private void FileSystemTree.search​(java.lang.String sampleText, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> path, FileSystemTree.FileNode currentHead)
      function makes use of recursion to trace the whole tree and find and print the desired path its base case is if current nodes' node name contains the sampleText then print the path starting from root and trace the whole tree each node
